page.title: 14Houses In GreyFriars (contd)
page.content: which ran from the Marston Road had been built shortly before.Building continued,although fewer new streets were laid out before the 1920s.Izaak Walton and Alliance Street off Stone Road just beyond the boundary were being laid out.There were then several villas in the Eccleshall Road itself, and more houses had been built there by 1900.First of the Salt Works by Stafford Common was opened in 1893.In the early 20th century several houses were built along North Street (later Stone Road)and Sandon Road.Council estates were built on either side of the Stone Road,north of the railway in the late 1920's and earlier 1930's. The privately built Holmcroft Estate west of the Stone Road dates from the mid 1930's and there was also private building in the period between the two world wars along the Eccleshall Road
